`⊤` is the greatest element

type: ∀ {α : Type u} [self : BooleanAlgebra α] (a : α), a ≤ ⊤
name: BooleanAlgebra.le_top
docString: `⊤` is the greatest element

If `α` is a second countable Borel space with a linear order and order topology, every countable family of measurable functions from a measurable space `δ` to `α` having the property that each element of `δ` is the greatest lower bound of the set of values of the family at some index, then the function that maps each element of `δ` to its greatest lower value is measurable.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} {δ : Type u_5} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_1 : MeasurableSpace α] [inst_2 : BorelSpace α]
  [inst_3 : MeasurableSpace δ] [inst_4 : LinearOrder α] [inst_5 : OrderTopology α] [inst : SecondCountableTopology α]
  {ι : Sort u_6} [inst : Countable ι] {f : ι → δ → α} {g : δ → α},
  (∀ (i : ι), Measurable (f i)) → (∀ (b : δ), IsGLB {a | ∃ i, f i b = a} (g b)) → Measurable g
name: Measurable.isGLB
docString: If `α` is a second countable Borel space with a linear order and order topology, every countable family of measurable functions from a measurable space `δ` to `α` having the property that each element of `δ` is the greatest lower bound of the set of values of the family at some index, then the function that maps each element of `δ` to its greatest lower value is measurable.

This theorem, known as the **Extreme Value Theorem**, states that for any function `f` from a set `β` to a linearly ordered set `α`, given that `f` is continuous on a closed subset `s` of `β` and that for any element `x₀` in `s`, `f`'s value at `x₀` is greater than its value at almost all points of `β` not in compact subsets and in `s`, there exists an element in `s` at which `f` attains its maximum. The conditions on `f` and `s` ensure that `f` behaves well within `s` and that `s` is a well-behaved topological space. In mathematical terms, it says that if a function is continuous on a closed set and it is smaller than a value in its image away from compact sets, then it has a maximum on this set.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_2} {β : Type u_3} [inst : LinearOrder α] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_2 : TopologicalSpace β]
  [inst_3 : ClosedIciTopology α] {s : Set β} {f : β → α},
  ContinuousOn f s →
    IsClosed s →
      ∀ {x₀ : β}, x₀ ∈ s → (∀ᶠ (x : β) in Filter.cocompact β ⊓ Filter.principal s, f x ≤ f x₀) → ∃ x ∈ s, IsMaxOn f s x
name: ContinuousOn.exists_isMaxOn'
docString: This theorem, known as the **Extreme Value Theorem**, states that for any function `f` from a set `β` to a linearly ordered set `α`, given that `f` is continuous on a closed subset `s` of `β` and that for any element `x₀` in `s`, `f`'s value at `x₀` is greater than its value at almost all points of `β` not in compact subsets and in `s`, there exists an element in `s` at which `f` attains its maximum. The conditions on `f` and `s` ensure that `f` behaves well within `s` and that `s` is a well-behaved topological space. In mathematical terms, it says that if a function is continuous on a closed set and it is smaller than a value in its image away from compact sets, then it has a maximum on this set.

If a differentiable function `f` is approximated by a linear map `A` on a set `s`, up to `δ`,
then at almost every `x` in `s` one has `‖f' x - A‖ ≤ δ`.

type:
∀ {E : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℝ E] [inst_2 : FiniteDimensional ℝ E] {s : Set E}
  {f : E → E} [inst_3 : MeasurableSpace E] [inst_4 : BorelSpace E] (μ : MeasureTheory.Measure E)
  [inst_5 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddHaarMeasure μ] {A : E →L[ℝ] E} {δ : NNReal},
  ApproximatesLinearOn f A s δ →
    MeasurableSet s →
      ∀ (f' : E → E →L[ℝ] E),
        (∀ x ∈ s, HasFDerivWithinAt f (f' x) s x) → ∀ᵐ (x : E) ∂MeasureTheory.Measure.restrict μ s, ‖f' x - A‖₊ ≤ δ
name: ApproximatesLinearOn.norm_fderiv_sub_le
docString:
If a differentiable function `f` is approximated by a linear map `A` on a set `s`, up to `δ`,
then at almost every `x` in `s` one has `‖f' x - A‖ ≤ δ`.

For any seminormed additive commutative group E, subset s, and real number δ, the set {x : E | ∥x∥ ≤ δ ∨ x ∈ s} equals the set {x : E | ∥x - o ∥ ≤ δ}, where o is the origin of E.

type: ∀ {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddCommGroup E] (δ : ℝ) (s : Set E), Metric.ball 0 δ + s = Metric.thickening δ s
name: ball_add_zero
docString: For any seminormed additive commutative group E, subset s, and real number δ, the set {x : E | ∥x∥ ≤ δ ∨ x ∈ s} equals the set {x : E | ∥x - o ∥ ≤ δ}, where o is the origin of E.

This theorem states that for any non-empty finite set `s` of type `β` and any function `f` from `β` to `α` (where `α` is a linearly ordered type), there exists an element `x` in `s` such that the image of `x` under `f` is greater than or equal to the image of any other element in `s` under `f`. In other words, `f(x)` is the maximum value attained by `f` on `s`.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_2} {β : Type u_3} [inst : LinearOrder α] (s : Finset β) (f : β → α),
  s.Nonempty → ∃ x ∈ s, ∀ x' ∈ s, f x' ≤ f x
name: Finset.exists_max_image
docString: This theorem states that for any non-empty finite set `s` of type `β` and any function `f` from `β` to `α` (where `α` is a linearly ordered type), there exists an element `x` in `s` such that the image of `x` under `f` is greater than or equal to the image of any other element in `s` under `f`. In other words, `f(x)` is the maximum value attained by `f` on `s`.

The set of points where a function is continuous is a Gδ set.

type:
∀ {X : Type u_1} {Y : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] [inst_1 : UniformSpace Y]
  [inst_2 : Filter.IsCountablyGenerated (uniformity Y)] (f : X → Y), IsGδ {x | ContinuousAt f x}
name: isGδ_setOf_continuousAt
docString: The set of points where a function is continuous is a Gδ set.

type: ∀ {α : Type u} [inst : LE α] [self : OrderBot α] (a : α), ⊥ ≤ a

If `s` has a greatest element, then it is bounded above.

type: ∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Preorder α] {s : Set α} {a : α}, IsGreatest s a → BddAbove s
name: IsGreatest.bddAbove
docString: If `s` has a greatest element, then it is bounded above.

The absolute value satisfies the triangle inequality

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} {S : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R] [inst_1 : OrderedSemiring S] (self : AbsoluteValue R S) (x y : R),
  MulHom.toFun self.toMulHom (x + y) ≤ MulHom.toFun self.toMulHom x + MulHom.toFun self.toMulHom y
name: AbsoluteValue.add_le'
docString: The absolute value satisfies the triangle inequality

The infimum of `x` and `xᶜ` is at most `⊥`

type: ∀ {α : Type u} [self : BooleanAlgebra α] (x : α), x ⊓ xᶜ ≤ ⊥
name: BooleanAlgebra.inf_compl_le_bot
docString: The infimum of `x` and `xᶜ` is at most `⊥`

Let `X` be a metric space. Let `K : ι → Set X` be a locally finite family of closed sets, let
`U : ι → Set X` be a family of open sets such that `K i ⊆ U i` for all `i`. Then there exists a
positive continuous function `δ : C(X, ℝ≥0)` such that for any `i` and `x ∈ K i`, we have
`Metric.closedBall x (δ x) ⊆ U i`.

type:
∀ {ι : Type u_1} {X : Type u_2} [inst : MetricSpace X] {K U : ι → Set X},
  (∀ (i : ι), IsClosed (K i)) →
    (∀ (i : ι), IsOpen (U i)) →
      (∀ (i : ι), K i ⊆ U i) →
        LocallyFinite K → ∃ δ, (∀ (x : X), 0 < δ x) ∧ ∀ (i : ι), ∀ x ∈ K i, Metric.closedBall x ↑(δ x) ⊆ U i
name: Metric.exists_continuous_nNReal_forall_closedBall_subset
docString:
Let `X` be a metric space. Let `K : ι → Set X` be a locally finite family of closed sets, let
`U : ι → Set X` be a family of open sets such that `K i ⊆ U i` for all `i`. Then there exists a
positive continuous function `δ : C(X, ℝ≥0)` such that for any `i` and `x ∈ K i`, we have
`Metric.closedBall x (δ x) ⊆ U i`.

$\lim_{x\to+\infty}|x|=+\infty$

docString: $\lim_{x\to+\infty}|x|=+\infty$

Let `X` be a metric space. Let `K : ι → Set X` be a locally finite family of closed sets, let

`Metric.closedBall x (δ x) ⊆ U i`.

type:
∀ {ι : Type u_1} {X : Type u_2} [inst : MetricSpace X] {K U : ι → Set X},
  (∀ (i : ι), IsClosed (K i)) →
    (∀ (i : ι), IsOpen (U i)) →
      (∀ (i : ι), K i ⊆ U i) →
        LocallyFinite K → ∃ δ, (∀ (x : X), 0 < δ x) ∧ ∀ (i : ι), ∀ x ∈ K i, Metric.closedBall x (δ x) ⊆ U i
name: Metric.exists_continuous_real_forall_closedBall_subset
docString:
Let `X` be a metric space. Let `K : ι → Set X` be a locally finite family of closed sets, let

docString: The supremum of `x` and `xᶜ` is at least `⊤`

**First moment method**. The maximum of an integrable function is greater than its integral.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} {m0 : MeasurableSpace α} {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α} {f : α → ℝ}
  [inst : MeasureTheory.IsProbabilityMeasure μ], MeasureTheory.Integrable f → ∃ x, ∫ (a : α), f a ∂μ ≤ f x
name: MeasureTheory.exists_integral_le
docString: **First moment method**. The maximum of an integrable function is greater than its integral.

the Hilbert epsilon Function

type: {α : Sort u} → [h : Nonempty α] → (α → Prop) → α
name: Classical.epsilon
docString: the Hilbert epsilon Function

Pointwise, the multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set eventually coincide
with the multiplicative indicator of the set as δ>0 tends to zero.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : PseudoEMetricSpace α] {β : Type u_2} [inst_1 : One β] (f : α → β) (E : Set α) (x : α),
  ∀ᶠ (δ : ℝ) in nhdsWithin 0 (Set.Ioi 0),
    Set.mulIndicator (Metric.thickening δ E) f x = Set.mulIndicator (closure E) f x
name: mulIndicator_thickening_eventually_eq_mulIndicator_closure
docString:
Pointwise, the multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set eventually coincide
with the multiplicative indicator of the set as δ>0 tends to zero.

The Dirac delta distribution

type:
(𝕜 : Type u_1) →
  {E : Type u_4} →
    (F : Type u_5) →
      [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] →
        [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℝ E] →
          [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup F] →
            [inst_3 : NormedSpace ℝ F] →
              [inst_4 : IsROrC 𝕜] →
                [inst_5 : NormedSpace 𝕜 F] → [inst_6 : SMulCommClass ℝ 𝕜 F] → E → SchwartzMap E F →L[𝕜] F
name: SchwartzMap.delta
docString: The Dirac delta distribution

The multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set tend pointwise to the multiplicative
indicator of the set, as δ>0 tends to zero.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : PseudoEMetricSpace α] {β : Type u_2} [inst_1 : One β] [inst_2 : TopologicalSpace β] (f : α → β)
  (E : Set α),
  Filter.Tendsto (fun δ => Set.mulIndicator (Metric.thickening δ E) f) (nhdsWithin 0 (Set.Ioi 0))
    (nhds (Set.mulIndicator (closure E) f))
name: tendsto_mulIndicator_thickening_mulIndicator_closure
docString:
The multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set tend pointwise to the multiplicative
indicator of the set, as δ>0 tends to zero.

Pointwise, the indicators of δ-thickenings of a set eventually coincide
with the indicator of the set as δ>0 tends to zero.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : PseudoEMetricSpace α] {β : Type u_2} [inst_1 : Zero β] (f : α → β) (E : Set α) (x : α),
  ∀ᶠ (δ : ℝ) in nhdsWithin 0 (Set.Ioi 0), Set.indicator (Metric.thickening δ E) f x = Set.indicator (closure E) f x
name: indicator_thickening_eventually_eq_indicator_closure
docString:
Pointwise, the indicators of δ-thickenings of a set eventually coincide
with the indicator of the set as δ>0 tends to zero.

A greatest element of a set is the supremum of this set.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : ConditionallyCompleteLattice α] {s : Set α} {a : α}, IsGreatest s a → sSup s = a
name: IsGreatest.csSup_eq
docString: A greatest element of a set is the supremum of this set.
